de.lessvoid.coregl.spi

Interface CoreSetup


  • public interface CoreSetup
    Helper to initialize a display and manages the render loop. This is a completely optional interface/class that you can use if you see it fits. Most actual programs that'll use the coregl-utils will use their own setup code and have probably not a use for this class. Still it's a handy class if you want some code to get up and running in a couple of minutes :)
    Author:
    void

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  CoreSetup.RenderLoopCallback
      You can implement this interface when you use the renderLoop() method.

      void initializeLogging()
      (optional) This method will just set a new jdk14 Formatter that is more readable then the defaults.
      void initializeLogging(String loggingProperties)
      (optional) This method will just set a new jdk14 Formatter that is more readable then the defaults and additionally reads the given loggingProperties from the Classpath and uses it to initialize the LogManager.
      void renderLoop(CoreSetup.RenderLoopCallback renderLoop)
      The renderLoop will keep updating the display and calls the RenderLoopCallback each frame.

        void initialize(String title,
                int width,
                int height)
         throws Exception
        Initialize.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the window
        width - width of the screen
        height - height of the screen
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of any errors

      • getInput

        CoreInput getInput()
        Returns:
        the CoreInput handle for this CoreSetup, if initialize(String, int, int) has been called; otherwise, this method returns null.

      • destroy

      • renderLoop

      • enableVSync

        Parameters:
